bwwExcerpt: This slice of The Prom, directed (and sparklingly choreographed) by Casey Nicholaw, is a fun surf through actorly vanity and ego: the stars are not monsters but opportunists, and it just so happens that this opportunism intersects with a belief in equality they all share
showScoreExcerpt:
"'The Prom' is encumbered with hackneyed familiarity when it comes to characters and plot, and a broad comedy and forced brightness and lightness where at least a tinge of darkness or reality would have been more welcome...The musical seeks to tell a simpler tale, yet it also aims to be both satire and cultural lesson...The message, ultimately, is positive...Itâ€™s just sad and depressing that the story and characters have to be so simple and unchallenging to get there."
